availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Taylor Hopkins (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha P. Cowen Hopkins in Henderson County, Kentucky, on February 10, 1831. Father of Charles Hopkins, Mary A. Hopkins, and Juliette H. Hopkins. Married to Esther Lynda Hawkins Hopkins in Henderson County on December 21, 1848. Father of Annah Hopkins, John Taylor Hopkins, Strother Banks Hopkins, Esther Hopkins, Edmund Hopkins, and Ella Hopkins. Resident of Henderson County in 1840. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1840. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860.
